Articles.Content:
WARNING: Not much is known about this plane, use at your own risk!

Introducing the new X-116, much heavier than the last design and totally unpredictable.

With an advanced S.A.S. and a few rscs it may last longer.

Otherwise besides that, it gets 2 or 3 times the max height of the X-115.

Every plane I make I get one step closer to my goal of 69,000.

Edited September 12, 2012 by Colderjake1524
This is no space plane. Its just a normal plane! What a rip off, gimme my money back! >.>
The RCS might be used to get into space...

This is no space plane. Its just a normal plane! What a rip off, gimme my money back! >.>

It could be, and besides spaceplanes was the name given to the planes when they were implemented.

It gets a max height of 20-30 thousand.

It could be, and besides spaceplanes was the name given to the planes when they were implemented.

It gets a max height of 20-30 thousand.

Imo people called the space planes...because people would be trying to MAKE space planes with them.

This is just a plane to me lol.

The RCS might be used to get into space...

you mean like this?
Guys it is called a "Space plane Hangar" and anything built in it could be called a "Space Plane", Anyways nice plane, How's it handle.

It is pretty wobbly but when you get it up in the air and turn on the sas it works fine.

I will work on it a little so it won't wobble as much.

It is pretty wobbly but when you get it up in the air and turn on the sas it works fine.

I will work on it a little so it won't wobble as much.

All of my space planes are super wobbly until they reach a certain altitude, I think it's mainly an artifact of the SAS' being such a harsh controller. (back in school we called controllers like them 'bang bang' controllers because they're either full on one way or the other, no smooth transitions)
